messages: 0b54b3d89537249641f25ef26c47e0f9 (02:37): should I always index my table?
0b54b3d89537249641f25ef26c47e0f9 (02:38): im having a table with no numerical common factor
0b54b3d89537249641f25ef26c47e0f9 (02:38): and I have no real need to add an ID
a4b2f111445d56946f87c02c5cd8b676 (02:38): Depends on a lot of things. Most people want to index most of their tables.
a4b2f111445d56946f87c02c5cd8b676 (02:38): Indexes are for searching within the table. If this table is to dump info, then you may not want the extra overhead of an index.
a4b2f111445d56946f87c02c5cd8b676 (02:39): Do you ever want to get data out of the table? Or run UPDATEs?
a4b2f111445d56946f87c02c5cd8b676 (02:39): Updates or deletes.
0b54b3d89537249641f25ef26c47e0f9 (02:39): its pretty dynamic in this sense

a4b2f111445d56946f87c02c5cd8b676 (02:40): Indexes will help UPDATE, DELETE, and SELECT queries. Sometimes INSERTs. They speed up looking for records. However, indexes also slow down the table because if you insert or modify data, the index has to be updated too.
